meanings.definition: Resembling cake in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The frosting on the cupcake looked even cakier than the one on the birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: The muffin was getting cakier as it sat out on the counter.
meanings.sent3: The pancake batter was so cakier than usual that it overflowed the pan.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned cakier with embarrassment as she tripped in front of everyone.
meanings.sent5: The clouds in the sky looked cakier than whipped cream, fluffy and inviting.

meanings.definition: Having a higher proportion of cake-like qualities.
meanings.sent1: The bakery's special bread was cakier than any other loaf in town.
meanings.sent2: The new recipe made the cookies cakier and more delicious than before.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur felt cakier than usual after rolling in the flour spilled on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The soil in the garden was cakier than expected, making it perfect for planting flowers.
meanings.sent5: The sweater was cakier than a sponge, absorbing every drop of spilled juice.

meanings.definition: Tending to become more like cake.
meanings.sent1: The batter was cakier than expected, so she added more flour to balance it out.
meanings.sent2: The mixture was becoming cakier with each stir of the spoon.
meanings.sent3: The snowball grew cakier as it rolled down the hill, picking up more snow.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded cakier as he tried to imitate the cartoon character.
meanings.sent5: The clay became cakier in her hands, perfect for molding into shapes.
